info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Schenectady, southeastern Fulton, southwestern Saratoga and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Glenville, or 8 miles east of Amsterdam, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amsterdam, Scotia, Glenville, Duanesburg, Hagaman, Fort Johnson, Galway, Rotterdam Junction, Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction, Burnt Hills, Tribes Hill, Charlton, Princetown, Parkis Mills, Hoffmans, Harding Crossing, Gifford, Young Corners, Garrison Manor and Woodruff Heights. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 24 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 25a and 27. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 1b. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
